analyzed: 'du shes kyi phung po ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi rang bzhin ni dpal he ru ka'o //

original: mig gnyis la ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
analyzed: mig gnyis la ni gti mug rdo rje'o //
translated: In the two eyes is Mohavajra,

analyzed: rna ba gnyis la ni zhe sdang rdo rje'o ; / sna la ni ser sna rdo rje'o // kho la ni 'dod chags rdo rje'o //

original: reg la ni phrag dog rdo rje'o //
analyzed: reg la ni phrag dog rdo rje'o //
translated: In the skin is Avarice Vajra.

original: skye mched thams cad la ni dbang phyug rdo rje'o //
analyzed: skye mched thams cad la ni dbang phyug rdo rje'o //
translated: In all the sense fields is Lord Vajra.

original: sa'i khams ni ltung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni ltung bar byed pa'o //
translated: The earth element is the one who causes falling.

original: chu'i khams ni gsod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsod par byed pa'o //

analyzed: me'i khams ni 'gugs par byed pa'o // rlung gi khams ni padma gar gyi dbang phyug go //

original: nam mkha'i khams ni padma'i dra bcan te /
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ni padma'i dra bcan te /
translated: The space element is the one who has a net of lotuses.

original: de dag ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi lha'i rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams kyi lha'i rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: These are the purities of the deities of the aggregates, elements, and sense fields.

original: de nas rdo rje'i gur bsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas rdo rje'i gur bsam par bya ste /
translated: Then one should imagine the vajra tent:

original: aom sumbha na sumbha ni h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom sumbha na sumbha ni h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, sumbha nisumbha hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat /🔽aom @187a * //
analyzed: aom grihna grihna h'um h'um phat / aom @187a * //
translated: Oṃ, gṛhṇa gṛhṇa hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: grihn'a pa ya grihn'a pa ya h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, gṛhṇāpaya gṛhṇāpaya hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

original: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga b'a na badzra h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom a'a na ya ho: bha ga b'a na badzra h'um h'um phat /
translated: Oṃ, ānayaho bhagavān vajra hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ.

analyzed: ces bya ba'i sngags shar phyogs la sogs par nges par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: One should arrange the mantra “oṃ vajra hetu maṃ” and so on in the east and so forth.

original: steng du ni mda'i dra ba'o //
analyzed: steng du ni mda'i dra ba'o //
translated: Above is the net of arrows.

original: sa gzhi ni yi ge h'um las sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin du byin gyis brlabs nas de'i 'od kyi snang ba las rdo rje'i re ba dang rdo rje'i bla re ste /

translated: The ground is blessed as the nature of a vajra cross from the syllable hūṃ. From the light of that, there is a vajra fence and a vajra tent.

original: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dushtam pra du shtam h'um h'um phat /
analyzed: aom gha gha gh'a ta ya gh'a ta ya sarba dushtam pra du shtam h'um h'um phat /
translated: oṃ gha gha ghatāya ghatāya sarva duṣṭaṃ praduṣṭaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

analyzed: k'i la ya k'i la ya sarba p'a pam h'um h'um phat /
translated: kālaya kālaya sarva pāpaṃ hūṃ hūṃ phaṭ

translated: hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ vajra kāya vajra dhara ājñāpayati sarva vighanān vinayaka kāya vāk citta vajra kāya hūṃ phaṭ

original: phur bus gdab pa'i sngags so//
analyzed: phur bus gdab pa'i sngags so//
translated: This is the mantra for striking with the dagger.

original: aom badzra mud gar badzra k'i la a'a ko ta ya h'um phat /
analyzed: aom badzra mud gar badzra k'i la a'a ko ta ya h'um phat /
translated: oṃ vajra mudgara vajra kāya ākoṭaya hūṃ phaṭ

original: phur bu brdung ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: phur bu brdung ba'i sngags so //
translated: This is the mantra for striking with the dagger.

original: de nas rang gi snying gar yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
analyzed: de nas rang gi snying gar yi ge aa las zla ba'i dkyil 'khor /
translated: Then, in one’s heart, from the syllable aḥ, there is a moon maṇḍala.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'phro bar bsam par byas la /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'phro bar bsam par byas la /
translated: On top of that, one should imagine the syllable hūṃ radiating various kinds of light rays.

original: de'i snang bas mdun du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / bla ma la sogs pa bltas la phyag bya ste /
analyzed: de'i snang bas mdun du yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / bla ma la sogs pa bltas la phyag bya ste /
translated: By its light, one should also see in front of oneself the perfect, fully enlightened Buddha, the guru, and so forth, and pay homage to them.

original: mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings to them.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba bya'o //
translated: Then, one should go for refuge to the Three Jewels.

original: de nas aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes bya ba brjod la /
analyzed: de nas aom sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharmm'a: sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham zhes bya ba brjod la /
translated: Then, one should recite “oṃ svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ svabhāva śuddho ’haṃ” and

original: yang ni stong par rnam bsam zhing //
analyzed: yang ni stong par rnam bsam zhing //
translated: imagine everything as emptiness.

original: sems tsam du yang des gnas bya //
analyzed: sems tsam du yang des gnas bya //
translated: One should also abide in the mind alone.

original: byang chub sems ni bsgom pa yis //
analyzed: byang chub sems ni bsgom pa yis //
translated: By cultivating the thought of awakening,

original: mig yor tsam gyi shes pa la //
analyzed: mig yor tsam gyi shes pa la //
translated: in the cognition that is like a visual distortion,

original: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: aom sh'u n+ya t'a dzny'a na badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: one should recite “oṃ śūnyatā jñāna vajra svabhāva ātmako ’haṃ.”

original: de nas langs nas rten dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa bee ram bha la sogs pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i yi ge yam yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa mdog sngon po'i rnam par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas langs nas rten dang brten pa'i tshul du gnas pa bee ram bha la sogs pa'i gnas la gnas pa'i yi ge yam yongs su gyur pa las rlung gi dkyil 'khor gzhu lta bu ba dan gyis mtshan pa mdog sngon po'i rnam par bsam par bya'o //
translated: Then, having risen, one should imagine the wind maṇḍala in the shape of a bow marked with a banner, blue in color, in the location of Vaiśālī, etc., in the manner of the support and the supported, arisen from the transformation of the syllable yaṃ.

original: de'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum 'bar bas mtshan pa kha dog dmar po'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du ram yongs su gyur pa las me'i dkyil 'khor gru gsum 'bar bas mtshan pa kha dog dmar po'o //
translated: Above that, from the transformation of the syllable raṃ, is the triangular fire maṇḍala, marked with flames, red in color.

original: de'i steng du yi ge bam yongs su gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po kha dog dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge bam yongs su gyur pa las chu'i dkyil 'khor zlum po kha dog dkar po bum pas mtshan pa'o //
translated: Above that, from the transformation of the syllable vaṃ, is the round water maṇḍala, white in color, marked with a vase.

original: de'i steng du yi ge lam yongs su gyur pa las /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge lam yongs su gyur pa las /
translated: Above that, from the transformation of the syllable laṃ,

original: sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
analyzed: sa'i dkyil 'khor gru bzhi pa kha dog ser po rdo rjes mtshan pa'o //
translated: is the square earth maṇḍala, yellow in color, marked with a vajra.

original: de'i steng du yi ge sum yongs su gyur pa las ri'i rgyal po ri rab zur bzhi pa rin po che sna @187b bzhi'i rang bzhin can rtse mo brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge sum yongs su gyur pa las ri'i rgyal po ri rab zur bzhi pa rin po che sna @187b bzhi'i rang bzhin can rtse mo brgyad kyis nye bar mdzes par byas pa'o //
translated: On top of that, from the transformation of the syllable SU, is the king of mountains, Mount Meru, with four sides, the nature of the four jewels, and beautified by eight peaks.

original: de'i steng du yi ge h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje /
analyzed: de'i steng du yi ge h'um las byung ba'i sna tshogs rdo rje /
translated: On top of that, from the syllable HUM, is a variegated vajra.

original: de'i steng du pam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lte ba dang ge sar du bcas pa /
analyzed: de'i steng du pam las byung ba'i sna tshogs padma 'dab ma brgyad pa lte ba dang ge sar du bcas pa /
translated: On top of that, from the syllable PAM, is an eight-petaled variegated lotus with a pericarp and filaments.

original: de'i dbus su a'a li k'a li'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dbus su a'a li k'a li'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: In the center of that is the union of Alikali.

original: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin can 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'phro bar bsams la /
analyzed: de'i dbus su yi ge h'um rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin can 'od zer sna tshogs rnam par 'phro bar bsams la /
translated: In the center of that, the syllable HUM, which is the nature of Vajrasattva, is imagined radiating various light rays.

original: de yongs su gyur pa las dpal he ru ka nyi ma la bzhugs shing dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang bcas pa dur khrod brgyad kyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: de yongs su gyur pa las dpal he ru ka nyi ma la bzhugs shing dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo dang bcas pa dur khrod brgyad kyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: From its complete transformation, one becomes glorious Heruka standing on a sun, together with the circle of the mandala, adorned by the eight charnel grounds.

original: de nas dur khrod rnams bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas dur khrod rnams bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then, the charnel grounds should be explained.

original: rdo rje ra ba'i nang du g-yon skar gyis phyogs thams cad dang / dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams bzhi bzhir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rdo rje ra ba'i nang du g-yon skar gyis phyogs thams cad dang / dbang ldan la sogs pa'i mtshams rnams bzhi bzhir brjod par bya ste /
translated: Inside the vajra fence, in all directions, beginning with the left, and in the four directions beginning with Indra, one should know the four🔽terrifying places.

original: drag tu gtum pa dang / tshang tshing 'khrigs pa dang / 'ur 'ur 'bar bas khyab pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su g-yon skor gyis legs par gnas so //
analyzed: drag tu gtum pa dang / tshang tshing 'khrigs pa dang / 'ur 'ur 'bar bas khyab pa dang / 'jigs su rung ba rnams shar la sogs pa'i phyogs su g-yon skor gyis legs par gnas so //
translated: The four terrifying places are: the place of the fierce and violent, the place of the thick and dense, the place of the blazing and roaring, and the place of the terrifying.

original: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su ni ha har dgod pa'o //
analyzed: dbang ldan gyi mtshams su ni ha har dgod pa'o //
translated: In the direction of Indra, there is the place of the loud and boisterous laughter.

original: byin za'i mtshams su ni nags tshal phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: byin za'i mtshams su ni nags tshal phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: In the direction of Agni, there is the place of the perfect forest.

original: srin po'i mtshams su ni mun pa mi bzad pa'o //
analyzed: srin po'i mtshams su ni mun pa mi bzad pa'o //
translated: In the direction of Rākṣasa, there is the place of the unbearable darkness.

original: rlung gi mtshams su ni k'i li k'i li'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung gi mtshams su ni k'i li k'i li'i sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: In the direction of Vāyu, there is the place of the sound of the wailing of kilikili.

original: rdo rjer ba'i dur khrod de rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gzugs kyi ro langs dang 'byung po 'dus pa ce spyang gi sgra sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rjer ba'i dur khrod de rnams ni 'jigs pa'i gzugs kyi ro langs dang 'byung po 'dus pa ce spyang gi sgra sgrogs pa'o //
translated: In those charnel grounds of the vajra fence, there are the zombies of terrifying forms, the assembled bhūtas, and the howling jackals.

original: rim pa de ltar gnas pa'i dur khrod brgyad po der shing dang / phyogs skyong ba dang / klu'i dbang po dang / sprin gyi dbang po rnams la sh'i ri sha dang / aa shvadtha dang / kam ka la dang / ts'u ta'i shing ste shar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rim pa de ltar gnas pa'i dur khrod brgyad po der shing dang / phyogs skyong ba dang / klu'i dbang po dang / sprin gyi dbang po rnams la sh'i ri sha dang / aa shvadtha dang / kam ka la dang / ts'u ta'i shing ste shar la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the eight charnel grounds situated in this way, the trees are the śāla tree, the aśvattha tree, the kaṃkala tree, and the caṃpaka tree, in the east and so on.

original: ba ta dang / ka ranydza ka dang / la t'a dza ti dang / parti ba'o //
analyzed: ba ta dang / ka ranydza ka dang / la t'a dza ti dang / parti ba'o //
translated: The rivers are the Vaitaraṇī, the Kṛṣṇaveṇī, the Lātājālī, and the Pārthivā.

original: de bzhin du dbang po dang / nor bdag dang / klu'i dbang po dang / gshin rje dang / dbang ldan dang / byin za dang / srin po'i dbang po dang / rlung bdag go //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po dang / nor bdag dang / klu'i dbang po dang / gshin rje dang / dbang ldan dang / byin za dang / srin po'i dbang po dang / rlung bdag go //
translated: Similarly, the lords of the directions are Indra, Kubera, the lord of the nāgas, Yama, Īśāna, Pracetā, the lord of the rākṣasas, and the lord of the wind.

original: de bzhin du nor rgyas dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / hu lun ta dang / rigs ldan dang / dung skyong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nor rgyas dang / 'jog po dang / stobs kyi rgyu dang / padma dang / padma chen po dang / hu lun ta dang / rigs ldan dang / dung skyong ngo //
translated: Similarly, the lords of the nāgas are Vāsuki, Takṣaka, Airāvata, Padma, Mahāpadma, Hūluṇṭa, Kulika, and Śaṅkhapāla.

original: de bzhin du sgra sgrogs pa dang / rmugs pa dang / mun pa can dang / kun du 'khyil pa dang / 'khrigs pa dang / drag po dang / 'bab pa dang / gang ba @188a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra sgrogs pa dang / rmugs pa dang / mun pa can dang / kun du 'khyil pa dang / 'khrigs pa dang / drag po dang / 'bab pa dang / gang ba @188a * //
translated: billowing, fierce, falling, and filling.

original: sprin gyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: sprin gyi bdag po ste /
translated: The lord of the clouds is called🔽meghavahana.

original: de rnams de bzhin du bsams nas /
analyzed: de rnams de bzhin du bsams nas /
translated: Having contemplated them in that way,

analyzed: g-yon pa'i phyag gsum pa la kha tv'am ga rdo rjes mtshan pa /
